nodes.bodyText: I think the two connectToService methods can be removed as well.

Typo: "cannot not".
The command message possibly was delivered to its target but got rejected there.
It could be added here that the reason a command gets rejected usually is that the message is invalid (or a message limit got exceeded).

nodes.bodyText: IMHO it would help readability to move this inner class to the bottom of the class.

The creation of the CommandHandlingAdapterInfoAccess object here and in the Quarkus AbstractProtocolAdapterApplication can be moved to the ProtonBasedCommandConsumerFactory constructor, passing along the  DeviceConnectionClient object instead of CommandHandlingAdapterInfoAccess.
This simplifies the code in AbstractAdapterConfig and AbstractProtocolAdapterApplication.

But it makes the factory (again) dependent on a particular other client which we already saw to be problematic. The config and application classes are the right place to set up the beans and that is what we are doing here. FMPOV there is no need to change this.

But it makes the factory (again) dependent on a particular other client which we already saw to be problematic.

As far as I remember, such a case was problematic when creating the factory in a bean method directly, where e.g. the used registration client bean was created via a @Scope("prototype") bean definition and there were therefore issues when requiring the very same registration client bean instance in the adapter instance that used the above factory bean.
But, with the setCollaborators method, from which the above commandConsumerFactory() method is called, we have already decoupled that. I don't see that another layer of decoupling is needed here, seeing that usage of the DeviceRegistrationClient is the primary way to create the factory. Therefore I think creating an additional ProtonBasedCommandConsumerFactory constructor with a DeviceRegistrationClient parameter would be a good way to remove some clutter and duplicate code from the AbstractAdapterConfig and AbstractProtocolAdapterApplication classes.
commandConsumerConnection() can be used here instead of HonoConnection.newConnection(vertx, config.command), it is unused otherwise.

nodes.bodyText: The onCommandConnectionEstablished method should be removed then as well. It is not used anymore.
The onCommandConnectionLost method should be removed then as well. It is not used anymore.

adapter.setCommandResponseSender(commandResponseSender());

is missing here (commandResponseSender() is currently not used).

FMPOV, an UnsupportedOperationException should be thrown here. The registerCommandConsumer method should not be invoked on the DeviceConnectionClient.
Same goes for the unregisterCommandConsumer method.

FMPOV, an UnsupportedOperationException should be thrown here. The registerCommandConsumer method should not be invoked on the DeviceConnectionClient.
Same goes for the unregisterCommandConsumer method.

I'm still not convinced that having the possibility to use just one bean (CommandRouterClient) for both the old commandConsumerFactory implementation and the new, CommandRouter-based one is worth the added confusion about the DeviceConnectionClient and CommandRouterClient being mixed up like this.
FMPOV, having a CommandRouterClient bean and a separate DeviceConnectionClient bean and allowing one or the other to be null would probably be easier to understand.
At least, when mixing the interfaces, I think it would be good to document the motivation in the DeviceConnectionClient javadoc.
